grails.plugin.multitenant.core.util
[Groovy] Class TenantUtils

java.lang.Object
  TenantUtils

class TenantUtils

Class that provides convenience methods for dealing with the multi-tenant plugin. It will allow to look up the current tenant and retrieve information about that tenant or any of the registered tenants. It will also allow you to perform operations with a specific tenant.

This method allows you to temporarily switch tenants to perform some operations.

static java.lang.Object getAllTenantData()

This will return a map of maps with the first map keyed by mapped tenant id for the data representing the tenants that are active in the system.
private static java.lang.Object getCachedTenantData()

This will retrieve the cache of tenant data and return a map of that data keyed by mapped tenant id.
static java.lang.Integer getCurrentTenant()

This will return the mapped tenant id of the currently mapped tenant.
static java.lang.String getCurrentTenantName()

This will return the name of the current tenant if that additional data is provided in the domain tenant object.

This will return a map of data representing the tenant for the mapped tenant id passed in.

This will return the name of the tenant if that additional data is provided in the domain tenant object.

Method Detail

doWithTenant

static void doWithTenant(java.lang.Integer tenantId, groovy.lang.Closure closure)
This method allows you to temporarily switch tenants to perform some operations. Before the method exits, it will set the tenantId back to what it was before.
Parameters:
tenantId - - The tenant Id you want to run the closure as.
closure - - The closure you want to run as the new tenant.

getAllTenantData

static java.lang.Object getAllTenantData()
This will return a map of maps with the first map keyed by mapped tenant id for the data representing the tenants that are active in the system.

getCachedTenantData

private static java.lang.Object getCachedTenantData()
This will retrieve the cache of tenant data and return a map of that data keyed by mapped tenant id.

getCurrentTenant

static java.lang.Integer getCurrentTenant()
This will return the mapped tenant id of the currently mapped tenant.
Returns:
The mapped tenant id

getCurrentTenantName

static java.lang.String getCurrentTenantName()
This will return the name of the current tenant if that additional data is provided in the domain tenant object. If the name is not provided the mapped tenant id will be returned instead.
Returns:
- The name of the current tenant or the mapped tenant id if the name is not provided in the Domain Tenant Map domain object.

getTenantData

static java.lang.Object getTenantData(java.lang.Object inTenantId)
This will return a map of data representing the tenant for the mapped tenant id passed in.

getTenantName

static java.lang.String getTenantName(java.lang.Object inTenantId)
This will return the name of the tenant if that additional data is provided in the domain tenant object. If the name is not provided the mapped tenant id will be returned instead.
Returns:
- The name of the tenant or the mapped tenant id if the name is not provided in the Domain Tenant Map domain object.

isAnnotated

static boolean isAnnotated(java.lang.Class aClass)
Whether or not a particular class is annotated as MultiTenant
Parameters:
aClass - - The class to check for the multi tenant annotation.
Returns:
- True if the class is annotated with the multi tenant annotation.

setCurrentTenant

void setCurrentTenant(CurrentTenant currentTenant)
This will allow the current tenant to be injected into the object.
Parameters:
currentTenant - - The current tenant resolver.
